Title: Object: Temptation
Description: Satire: St Antony in a cave, kneeling in prayer before a crucifix on a rock on the left, while an attractive young woman tries to distract him, her clawed hand on his shoulder revealing her to be a demon; after David Teniers the Younger; republished state. c.1760 Hand-coloured mezzotint
Curator's comments: For states and more information, see 2010,7081.1347
Bibliographic references: BM Satires / Catalogue of Political and Personal Satires in the Department of Prints and Drawings in the British Museum (3774)
Chaloner Smith 1883 / British Mezzotinto portraits from the introduction of the art to the early part of the present century (undescribed)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
